TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:

That's why I said that I'm pretty sure SVE has nothing to do with this problem...

I'm trying to find where in <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> there's a sunflare texture. Can you point me to it? I did update all of <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr>'s dependencies, and the terrain textures seem to be working, but this is my first time using <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> so I'm not sure what, if anything, is missing.

you CANNOT use <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> and SVE together unless you know what you are doing. both mods are visual mods and will conflict. This is why i created SVT for terrain textures. There are guides in the forum somewhere that help you use <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr>'s ground textures along with SVEs clouds but you will have to search for it.

<abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> has its own clouds that clash with SVE so they will need to be removed

FWIW I wasn't having any issues with the two together until I updated to the new SVE and tried changing Scatterer's sunflare. I had already replaced the sunflare once with no problems.

> FWIW I wasn't having any issues with the two together until I updated to the new SVE and tried changing Scatterer's sunflare. I had already replaced the sunflare once with no problems.
> 

That's because the cfg structure for scatterer has changed to include its sun flare cfg. <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> will have to update to work properly with scatterer.

> 10 hours ago, Galileo said:

> 
> That's not true. The latest version of SVE does not overwrite anything except the atmo cfgs of the bodies. It does not overwrite the sunflare or the ocean shaders any longer. Now the control over performance and options is in the users hands. Also, SVE no longer bundles a sunflare due to too many people complaining about not knowing how to replace textures. Go download the latest version 1.2.5.0
> 

Im sorry for wrong info, had 1.2.5 installed but reverted to older version faster than i realised it doesn't do a lot of things it did previously.  

Need some help with this: ![5yQdTCo.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/5yQdTCo.jpg)

I have no idea what causes that. Those artifacts appear only at pretty low altitude over the water.

[@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) you have experience with Sunflares I think - reckon you can help with this (hopefully) simple fix?

I have a small star which I'd like to zoom into, but the stock sunflare and the scatterer subflare both fade away, leaving the bare star texture, which is relatively ugly. Do you know of a way to stop the sunflare from fading out or reducing the range?

Cheers.

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, Gameslinx said:
> 
> 
> [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) you have experience with Sunflares I think - reckon you can help with this (hopefully) simple fix?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I have a small star which I'd like to zoom into, but the stock sunflare and the scatterer subflare both fade away, leaving the bare star texture, which is relatively ugly. Do you know of a way to stop the sunflare from fading out or reducing the range?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Cheers.
> 

There is a parameter in the sunflare configs (I can't think of the name at the moment) and I think the default value is 250000 or something like that. That value is how close you get to the sun before the sunflare disappears. You could technically set that to 0 and keep the sunflare even when zoomed in I think. I'm not a my pc otherwise I would be more precise. I think the parameter I'm talking about is named pretty   straight forward

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-14T16:32:45Z" title="07/14/2017 04:32  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 14, 2017</time> by Galileo**

I'm having some trouble with scatterer's sunflare. Looks like the stock sunflare isn't being overwritten...?

Output: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/xtnucn3ev4dggy6/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xtnucn3ev4dggy6/output_log.txt?dl=0)

Here's a screenshot of what it's supposed to look like:

![41fb860b0b.png](https://puu.sh/wJInk/41fb860b0b.png)

And here's one of what it currently looks like (it's loading the sunflare texture, but it's not *replacing* the stock flare):

![6a36b7ea50.png](https://puu.sh/wJIan/6a36b7ea50.png)

Gamedata:

![62f9cdd7c0.png](http://puu.sh/wJJfr/62f9cdd7c0.png)

I love how scatterer makes game look beyond beautiful but there is one issue keeps annoying me;

![5QyLMz.jpg](https://i.hizliresim.com/5QyLMz.jpg)

![Akzn5v.jpg](https://i.hizliresim.com/Akzn5v.jpg)

Planes look like they're out of place, they have almost zero lighting from ambiance. I wonder if blackrack or somebody else has plan to do anything about it. It'd be totally epic.

I also have some scatterer settings questions. I've been messing around with the settings and have come up with an atmosphere that I really like for Kerbin (at least in map view). I was trying to get rid of these terrain highlights on the dark side using `MapExtinctionMultiplier`. Here it is with the multiplier at its default value:

![3cc1cb5f8a.png](https://puu.sh/wJJ9E/3cc1cb5f8a.png)

And here's what I want it to look like (the multiplier set to 0):

![b67b01195e.png](https://puu.sh/wJJb7/b67b01195e.png)

BUT, when the multiplier is set to zero, obviously the terrain disappears (notice the island to the left of the Saturn K).

Is there another setting I could mess with that could get me that pitch black dark side, but also still show the terrain on the day side?
